title_en: ‚ÄúI have never raised the issue of reprisals,‚Äù the Minister of Labor says in connection with the accusations of trade unions from this portfolio claiming that the strike is prohibited
summary_en:
The workers' union expressed dissatisfaction with the administration, considering that they were not given the opportunity to be heard in the labor process.
Claims are filed in accordance with the procedure established by law, which is considered the right of every employee.
The main complaint of the trade union is that the labor portfolio was not given the opportunity to express concerns to the national government.
The Government has committed itself to ensuring fair and transparent labor processes in accordance with constitutional guarantees.
The authorities insist that they are ready to listen and meet the demands of the workers.
The unions of the Ministry of Labor have sent a letter to the Minister and other officials condemning actions that harm their right to strike.
The Ministry of Labor announced the approval of one of the demands of the trade unions and asked the striking officials to cancel the strike.

title_en: New problems of Petro's pension reform: the union of trade unions says that the company is not ready and is considering going on strike
summary_en:
Trade unions have expressed concern about unsatisfied demands in connection with pension reform.
The president of the Trade Union of Employees of Enterprises (Sintracolpen) stated that the company will not be able to carry out reform without resolving petitions.
Sintracolpen members are at the site in front of the Colpensiones headquarters in Bogota, expressing concern about the implementation of the reform.
A key problem for Sintracolpen is the lack of technological improvements to cope with the expected increase in workload.
The union demands an increase in wages and a solution to structural problems in the management of positions.
The president of Colpensiones has not entered into a dialogue with the union since August 2023, increasing frustration among union members.
If the pension reform is not adopted by June 20, it will collapse, and the government of President Gustavo Petro is doing everything possible to avoid such a scenario.

title_en: Venezuelan prisoners have gone on hunger strike due to delays in the administration of justice and poor conditions of detention
summary_en:
Prisoners in Venezuela have gone on hunger strike due to delays in the administration of justice and poor conditions of detention.
The mass protest revealed serious flaws in the Venezuelan judicial system, which international bodies had warned about.
The women began protests demanding the release of prisoners with at least 50% of their sentences served and other discounts on sentences.
The strike continues to spread to more prisoners, wives, mothers, sisters and other relatives demonstrated in front of the courthouse in Caracas on Wednesday.
President Nicolas Maduro has announced his intention to end corruption in prisons and build a new administration and prison regime.
The dismissal of the minister does not solve the structural problem, and the judicial revolution has not led to significant results.
The government focused on intervening in prisons, but the gang leaders managed to escape before the authorities arrived.
At the height of the strike, there were reports of attacks on prisoners by security agencies and the death of a prisoner due to lack of medical care.

title_en: "I don't care if I die here": two firefighters have been on hunger strike for 15 days against Ayuso and the Leganes City Council
summary_en:
Two firefighters, Charles Rodriguez and Ruben Agudo, have been paid just over 700 euros per month for three years.
They are listed as employees who are in a state of forced leave due to many administrative errors.
Firefighters have been on hunger strike for 15 days and 14 nights in front of the Madrid City Hall, demanding their seats be returned.
They claim that in other municipalities, the community of Madrid has allowed corps personnel to remain under municipal administration.
The Leganes City Council acknowledges that the local government is "trying to mediate," even though the ball is in the hands of the Madrid community.
Firefighters assure that in other municipalities, the community of Madrid has indeed allowed corps personnel to remain under municipal control.
